slides.title: Choosing the Right Chart
slides.content:
# Chart Types ğŸ“Š

Matching charts to data.

## Four Questions

1. **Comparison?** Bar charts
2. **Trend over time?** Line charts
3. **Part of whole?** Pie/stacked
4. **Relationship?** Scatter plots

## Quick Reference

| Purpose | Chart |
|---------|-------|
| Compare categories | Bar |
| Show trend | Line |
| Part of whole | Pie, Stacked |
| Correlation | Scatter |
| Distribution | Histogram |

> ğŸ¯ Let the question guide the chart!

slides.title: Comparison Charts
slides.content:
# Comparison Charts ğŸ“Š

## Bar Chart

- Compare categories
- Horizontal for long labels
- Order by value when possible

## Grouped Bar

- Compare across groups
- Limit to 3-4 groups

## Bullet Chart

- Actual vs target
- Compact dashboard use

## Best Practices

- Start y-axis at zero
- Use consistent colors
- Order logically
- Label directly when possible

> ğŸ’¡ Bar charts are the workhorses of data viz!

slides.title: Time Series Charts
slides.content:
# Time Series Charts ğŸ“ˆ

## Line Chart

- Show trends over time
- Connect data points
- Use for continuous data

## Area Chart

- Emphasize volume
- Stacked for composition

## Sparklines

- Tiny inline charts
- Show trend in a cell

## Best Practices

- Time flows left to right
- Label axis clearly
- Don't connect unrelated series
- Limit to 4-5 lines

> ğŸ¯ Line charts reveal patterns over time!

slides.title: Distribution Charts
slides.content:
# Distribution Charts ğŸ“Š

## Histogram

- Distribution of one variable
- Shows frequency

## Box Plot

- Median, quartiles, outliers
- Compare distributions

## Violin Plot

- Distribution shape
- Combines box + density

## When to Use

| Chart | Use For |
|-------|--------|
| Histogram | Single variable shape |
| Box plot | Compare groups |
| Violin | Detailed distribution |

> ğŸ’¡ Distributions tell the full story!

slides.title: Relationship Charts
slides.content:
# Relationship Charts ğŸ”—

## Scatter Plot

- Two continuous variables
- Shows correlation
- Add trend line

## Bubble Chart

- Add third dimension (size)
- Use sparingly

## Heatmap

- Value matrix
- Color encodes magnitude

## Best Practices

- Label axes clearly
- Consider overplotting (use transparency)
- Add reference lines

> ğŸ¯ Scatter plots reveal relationships!
